abstract: Pfizer said Tuesday that it had licensed the worldwide rights to a treatment for Gaucher disease, a rare genetic disorder, from Protalix Biotherapeutics, an Israeli biotechnology company.

lead_paragraph: The world’s largest drug company is thinking small. Pfizer said Tuesday that it had licensed the worldwide rights to a treatment for Gaucher disease, a rare genetic disorder, from Protalix Biotherapeutics, an Israeli biotechnology company, The New York Times’s Andrew Pollack writes.

headline.main: Pfizer Deal Signals Move Into Rare Diseases
